matchPlugin.title: Plugins
matchPlugin.description: A simple pattern to match the data collection plugins that are collecting the data this rule is to be applied to. The values it takes are shown as _collect_plugin at the labels filter of the charts on the dashboard.

matchModule.title: Modules
matchModule.description: A simple pattern to match the data collection plugin modules that are collecting the data this rule is to be applied to. The values it takes are shown as _collect_module at the labels filter of the charts on the dashboard.

matchInstanceLabels.title: Only for instances with these labels
matchInstanceLabels.description: A simple pattern to match the instance labels of the instances this rule is to be applied to. A space separated list of label=value pairs is accepted. Asterisks can be placed anywhere, including the label key. The label keys and their values are available at the labels filter of the charts on the dashboard.

matchHostLabels.title: Only for nodes with these host labels
matchHostLabels.description: A simple pattern to match the node labels of the nodes this rule is to be applied to. A space separated list of label=value pairs is accepted. Asterisks can be placed anywhere, including the label key. The label keys and their values are available at the labels filter of the charts on the dashboard.

matchHostnames.title: Only for these hostnames
matchHostnames.description: A simple pattern to match the hostnames of the nodes this rule is to be applied to.

matchOs.title: Operating Systems
matchOs.description: A simple pattern to match the operating system name of the nodes this rule is to be applied to. The operating system names are available at the global nodes filter, with label key _os_name.

matchInstance.title: Apply this rule to a single instance
matchInstance.description: This rule will be applied to a specific instance on all nodes

on.title: The instance this rule should be applied to
on.description: You can find the instance names on all charts at the instances drop down menu. Do not include the host name in this field.

matchTemplate.title: Apply this rule to all instances of a context
matchTemplate.description: This rule will applied to all instances on all nodes.

on.title: The context of the instances this rule should be applied to
on.description: The context is the code-name of each chart on the dashboard, that appears at the chart title bar, between the chart title and its unit of measurement, like: system.cpu, disk.io, etc.

instances.title: On on these instances
instances.description: A simple pattern to match the instance names of the instances this rule is to be applied to.

config.title: Alert Configuration
config.description: The properties that control the value the alert will get, the conditions it will trigger, the back-off for notifications, the auto-repeating of notifications, etc.

summary.title: Short description of the alert
summary.description: This field is used in notification as a short description of the alert. Variables, like ${label:key}, are replaced with the value of instance label called 'key'.

info.title: Long description of the alert
info.description: This field is used to provide enough information about the type and nature of the alert. Variables, like ${label:key}, are replaced with the value of instance label called 'key'.

type.title: Alert Type
type.description: Use categories like: 'System', 'Containers', 'Web Servers', 'Message Brokers', etc.

component.title: Alert Component
component.description: Component is a sub-type of Alert Type. Examples: 'CPU', 'Memory', 'Network', 'Disk', 'Hardware', 'nginx', 'redis', 'postgresql', etc.

value.title: Alert Value Calculation
value.description: Each alert has a value. This section defines how this value is calculated.

database_lookup.title: Database Query to Get Value
database_lookup.description: The database query to be executed to calculate the value of the alert. When set, the query is executed before any other calculations. The result of the query will be available as $this in further calculations.

after.title: From
after.description: The oldest timestamp of the time-series data to be included in the query. Negative values define a duration in seconds in the past (so, -60 means a minute ago).

before.title: To
before.description: The newest timestamp of the time-series data to be included in the query. Negative value define a duration in seconds in the past (so, -60 means a minute ago). Zero means now.

dimensions.title: Dimensions
dimensions.description: A simple pattern to match the dimensions that should be included in the query

oneOf.title: The mean (average) value
The median value
The minimum value
The maximum value
The sum of all the values
The delta of the latest and oldest values
The standard deviation of the values
The standard deviation expresses as a % of the mean value
The mean after trimming 1% of the extreme values
The mean after trimming 2% of the extreme values
The mean after trimming 3% of the extreme values
The mean after trimming 5% of the extreme values
The mean after trimming 10% of the extreme values
The mean after trimming 15% of the extreme values
The mean after trimming 20% of the extreme values
The mean after trimming 25% of the extreme values
The median after trimming 1% of the extreme values
The median after trimming 2% of the extreme values
The median after trimming 3% of the extreme values
The median after trimming 5% of the extreme values
The median after trimming 10% of the extreme values
The median after trimming 15% of the extreme values
The median after trimming 20% of the extreme values
The median after trimming 25% of the extreme values
The 99th percentile of the values
The 98th percentile of the values
The 97th percentile of the values
The 95th percentile of the values

Double Exponential Smoothing

grouping.title: Time Aggregation Function
grouping.description: When querying time-series data we need to come up with a single value. This function is used to aggregate all the values of the time-series data to a single value.

options.title: Time-Series Query options
options.description: Options affecting the way the value is calculated

oneOf.title: Do not shift the time-frame for visual presentation
Make all values positive before using them
Use the delta of the minimum to the maximum value
Treat gaps in the time-series as a zero value
Calculate the percentage of the selected dimensions over the sum of all dimensions
Query the anomaly rate of the samples collected
Match only dimension IDs, not Names
Match only dimension Names, not IDs

calculation.title: Calculation to Transform the Value
calculation.description: The database value is available as '$this'. This expression can utilize variables to transform the value of the alert.

units.title: Unit
units.description: The unit of measurement the alert value is expressed with. If unset, the units of the instance the alert is attached to will be used.

warning_condition.title: Warning Expression
warning_condition.description: The alert value is available as '$this'. If this expression evaluates to a non-zero value, the alert is considered to be in warning level.

critical_condition.title: Critical Expression
critical_condition.description: The alert value is available as '$this'. If this expression evaluates to a non-zero value, the alert is considered to be in critical level.

green.title: Healthy threshold
green.description: A threshold that indicates a healthy status. This threshold can be used as '$green' in the alert conditions.

red.title: Critical threshold
red.description: A threshold that indicates a critical status. This threshold can be used as '$red' in the alert conditions.

action.title: Alert Action (notification or automation)
action.description: The action the alert should take when it transitions states

execute.title: Command to execute when the alert transitions states
execute.description: Leave this empty to get the default alert notification

recipient.title: Recipient(s)
recipient.description: A space separated list of the recipients of the alert notifications. The special recipient 'silent' prevents this alert from taking any action (i.e. sending notifications).

options.title: Action Options
options.description: Options related to the actions this alert will take.

oneOf.title: Do not perform any action when the alert is cleared

delay.title: Delay the action (notification)
delay.description: Rules to postpone the action, to avoid multiple notifications on flapping alerts.

up.title: Delay when raising
up.description: Delay the action (notification) that many seconds, when the alert is rising.

down.title: Delay when going Down
down.description: Delay the action (notification) that many seconds, when the alert is recovering.

multiplier.title: Back-Off
multiplier.description: Multiply the delay by this number, every time the alert transitions to a new state, while the action (notification) is being delayed.

max.title: Max
max.description: The maximum acceptable delay in seconds, for taking the action (notification).

repeat.title: Auto-Repeat Action
repeat.description: Repeat the action while the alert is raised.

warning.title: Repeat on Warning
warning.description: The number of seconds to repeat the action while the alert is in warning state

critical.title: Repeat on Critical
critical.description: The number of seconds to repeat the action while the alert is in critical state

oneOf.title: Apply this rule to a specific instance (deprecated)
Apply this rule to all instances

type.title: Type of rule
type.description: Rules can be configured to match a specific instance (like a specific disk), or match all the instances (like all the disks). All rules are always checked against all nodes streamed to this Netdata, so the matching rules include patterns to match both instances and nodes.
